definitions.definition: An enclosed space; a courtyard; an uncovered area shut in by the walls of a building, or by different buildings; also, a space opening from a street and nearly surrounded by houses; a blind alley.
definitions.example: The girls were playing in the court.

definitions.definition: Attention directed to a person in power; behaviour designed to gain favor; politeness of manner; civility towards someone
A place arranged for playing the games of tennis, basketball, squash, badminton, volleyball and some other games
definitions.example: The local sports club has six tennis courts and two squash courts.

definitions.definition: To seek to achieve or win.
definitions.example: He was courting big new accounts that previous salesman had not attempted.
He courted controversy with his frank speeches.

definitions.definition: To try to win a commitment to marry from.
To engage in behavior leading to mating.
definitions.example: The bird was courting by making an elaborate dance.

definitions.definition: To attempt to gain alliance with.
To engage in activities intended to win someone's affections.
definitions.example: She's had a few beaus come courting.
In this season, you can see many animals courting.

definitions.definition: To invite by attractions; to allure; to attract.
